intro: Roepera spinosa, commonly known as the spiny roepera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems covered in sharp, spiny structures, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Roepera spinosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
